messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] GA unschoolers (also MD unschoolers)
messages.msgSnippet: A friend had started one for Anne Arundel County.  It s still there, just pretty inactive.  Go to Yahoo groups and look for aacu (Anne Arundel County
messages.messageBody:
A friend had started one for Anne Arundel County. It's still there, just pretty inactive. Go to Yahoo groups and look for aacu (Anne Arundel County Unschoolers).

If you're interested, I have been going to an unschooling group in Catonsville. They meet at each other's homes once a month. Tomorrow is the next meeting, from 5-7. I can give you directions.

~Melissa, in Odenton (Piney Orchard) :)

----- Original Message -----
From: kbcdlovejo@...
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, February 22, 2008 12:14 PM
Subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] GA unschoolers



-----Original Message-----
From: Maisha Khalfani <maitai373@...>

Is there an unschoolers group for Maryland?

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-

Maybe. I don't know.

If not, you could start one!

If you build it, they will come....

~Kelly

Kelly Lovejoy
Conference Coordinator
Live and Learn Unschooling Conference
http://www.LiveandLearnConference.org

messages.messageBody:
>

> From: Maisha Khalfani <maitai373@...
> <mailto:maitai373%40comcast.net>>
>
> Is there an unschoolers group for Maryland?

Yes: Maryland Organic Learning:

http://maryland.organiclearning.org/

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/MarylandOrganicLearning/

There are also some more local groups listed, depending where you are. I
started one for the Hagerstown area, and we meet very sporadically.

--
~~Danielle
Emily (10), Julia (9), Sam (7)
http://www.organiclearning.blogspot.com

~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*

Is there an unschoolers group for Maryland?



be at peace,

Maisha

<http://khalfanifamilyadventures.blogspot.com/> Khalfani Family Adventures

<http://earthspiritjourneys.blogspot.com/> EarthSpirit Journeys




Have you tried GAUnschoolers@yahoogroups.com
<mailto:GAUnschoolers%40yahoogroups.com> ? I know Madeline's farm
is north of Atlanta a bit. And I think Laura is in Marietta. Melinda,
Beth, Wendy--There's a BIG crew of Georgians. In fact, we were just in
Flintstone, GA this past weekend with Mindy and her family---an
unschoolers weekend, just south of Chattanooga. Duncan's still there,
hanging with six other unschooling kids ranging in age from 6-13.

messages.subject: GA unschoolers
messages.msgSnippet: ... From: carnationsgalore  I live in Forsyth County in Georgia.  In the 6 years we ve been homeschooling, we haven t been very
messages.messageBody:
-----Original Message-----
From: carnationsgalore <addled.homemaker@...>

I live in Forsyth County in Georgia. In the 6 years we've been
homeschooling, we haven't been very successful in hooking up with
other people.

-=-=-=-=

Have you tried GAUnschoolers@yahoogroups.com ? I know Madeline's farm
is north of Atlanta a bit. And I think Laura is in Marietta. Melinda,
Beth, Wendy--There's a BIG crew of Georgians. In fact, we were just in
Flintstone, GA this past weekend with Mindy and her family---an
unschoolers weekend, just south of Chattanooga. Duncan's still there,
hanging with six other unschooling kids ranging in age from 6-13.

-=-=-=-=-=-

> And is it possible for you to make it to an unschooling
> conference?
> ~Kelly

My dd9 and I were looking at the Live and Learn conference information
just last night. We'd love to attend and will probably do so if we
can manage the money.

-=-=-=-=-

I hope you can make it! Your circle of unschooling friends would
increase HUGELY after that weekend---and you have so many so close!

~Kelly, in Columbia, SC

Kelly Lovejoy
Conference Coordinator
Live and Learn Unschooling Conference
http://www.LiveandLearnConference.org
